body.p: Purchaser elects to apply the optional concentration test set out in paragraph B7B and concludes that:

li.p: the identifiable assets that could be recognised in a business combination include the sublicence to distribute Product X, customer contracts and the supply contract;
the sublicence and customer contracts are in different classes of intangible assets, so they are not similar identifiable assets; and
consequently, the fair value of the gross assets acquired is not substantially all concentrated in a single identifiable asset or group of similar identifiable assets.

body.p: Consequently, Purchaser assesses whether the set of activities and assets meets the minimum requirements to be considered a business in accordance with paragraphs B8–B12D.
